homeSpace.name: Home Spaces
homeSpace.categoryPageText: Today, our homes have become an extension of the office with 68% of people now splitting time between the two. While the sudden shift to remote work had people scrambling to put together makeshift workspaces, the time has come to design your home space to work harder for you—while keeping distractions at bay.

rooms.name: Home Office
roomDescription: For those who have a dedicated home office, it’s essential to design it in a way that lets you work as efficiently and securely as any corporate office—not to mention, more comfortably.
With the luxury of a little extra space, you can outfit your home office with devices that give you the flexibility to take one meeting at your desk and another on a bigger screen.

rooms.name: Kitchen Room
roomDescription: Not everyone has the luxury of a dedicated home office. For many of us, our kitchens have become our place to work. These tight—and often temporary workspaces—also include a recipe of distractions, noise, and guest appearances.
But when you mix portable collaboration devices with noise-cancelling headsets and a sprinkle of secure wireless connectivity, voila! Your kitchen becomes a productive powerhouse.

officeSpace.name: Office Spaces
officeSpace.categoryPageText: Gone are the days where the office was a permanent destination for all employees. With people now constantly coming and going, each room needs to be designed to serve a specific purpose. In addition, 97% want changes to make the office safer before they return, which only adds another layer of complexity to your office transformation.

anywhere.name: Anywhere
anywhere.categoryPageText: Work happens anywhere, even on the go—whether that’s traveling, enjoying a cup of coffee at your favorite café, or in the field on the frontlines. You need the right solutions that will keep you connected, focused, and secure so your work keeps on moving right alongside you.
